events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of May 1st, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The insurance claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on descriptions referencing a vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case promptly to ensure swift communication with the customer.
The claim was officially acknowledged, and the customer was informed about the next steps for providing documentation.
Customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and any witness statements available.
All required documents, including vehicle damage photos and accident reports, were submitted by the insured for review.
Investigation began to assess the accident circumstances, verify damages, and determine liability for the collision.
Investigators concluded the review and confirmed the validity of the claim with clear evidence supporting customer’s account.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses due to the accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the clear communication throughout the claim process.
The claim was approved based on the investigation report and acceptance of the settlement offer by the insured.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the customer’s designated account to cover documented repair costs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation of receipt of payment and satisfaction expressed by the claimant.
All documentation and records related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
